intro: Oenothera gaura, commonly known as whorled gaura, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and clusters of small, showy flowers. The plant typically blooms in summer, producing pink to white flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Oenothera gaura thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for gardens and natural landscapes. Its delicate appearance and ability to reseed itself contribute to its ecological and ornamental value.
